title: How to Care for Teak

steps.headline: Restore its lustre.
steps.description: At the beginning of the outdoor season, when the weather starts to warm up again, and also at the end of the summer season, apply a coat of teak oil to your teak furniture. This will produce a lustrous shine.

steps.headline: Conserve the patina of the teak.
steps.description: In order to preserve teak's natural patina, wash it once yearly using clean water. This will remove all dust and dirt that has accumulated during use.

steps.headline: Remove stains.
steps.description: If there are any stains on your teak furniture, attend to them promptly. Rub stains lightly using a steel wool pad or sandpaper of a fine grade.

steps.headline: Check the screws.
steps.description: It's a good idea to make regular checks of the screws on teak furniture. If they need tightening, retighten them. This ensures that the teak furniture remains strong and stable, and avoids breakage.

text: Restore its lustre. At the beginning of the outdoor season, when the weather starts to warm up again, and also at the end of the summer season, apply a coat of teak oil to your teak furniture. This will produce a lustrous shine. Conserve the patina of the teak. In order to preserve teak's natural patina, wash it once yearly using clean water. This will remove all dust and dirt that has accumulated during use. Remove stains. If there are any stains on your teak furniture, attend to them promptly. Rub stains lightly using a steel wool pad or sandpaper of a fine grade. Check the screws. It's a good idea to make regular checks of the screws on teak furniture. If they need tightening, retighten them. This ensures that the teak furniture remains strong and stable, and avoids breakage.
